data.value: that are not in the caller are added as new columns.
If a list of dict/series is passed and the keys are all contained in the DataFrame's index, the order of the columns in the resulting DataFrame will be unchanged.

Iteratively appending rows to a DataFrame can be more computationally intensive than a single concatenate. A better solution is to append those rows to a list and then concatenate the list with the original DataFrame all at once.

children.type_: DataFrame or Series/dict-like object, or list of these

data.value: If True, the resulting axis will be labeled 0, 1, …, n - 1.
If True, raise ValueError on creating index with duplicates.

data.value: The following, while not recommended methods for generating DataFrames, show two ways to generate a DataFrame from multiple data sources.
General function to concatenate DataFrame or Series objects.

signature.value: append(self, other, ignore_index: 'bool' = False, verify_integrity: 'bool' = False, sort: 'bool' = False) -> 'DataFrame'
